textContent:
The --stdin option allows you to pass standard input (stdin) to the command you are executing. This is useful for commands that require input from the user during execution.

The --tty option allocates a TTY (teletype) for the container, which enables an interactive terminal session. This option is required for interactive commands that require a TTY.

The -c option specifies the container name to execute the command in. In this case, the container name is monolith
title: kubectl exec monolith --stdin --tty -c monolith -- /bin/sh
